content: A software quality assurance plan should be based principally on the quality requirements of
Maintenance releases and technical assistance centers are examples of which of the following costs of quality?
Which of the following is a fundamental principle of software defect prevention?

choices.A: Software quality engineering must evaluate all errors.
choices.B: A balance of white-box and black-box testing is necessary.
choices.C: A single root cause taxonomy should be used by all projects.
choices.D: Feedback to the individuals who introduced the defect is essential.

content: Which of the following obstacles is most likely to cause a quality management system to fail?

choices.B: Fear that quality improvements will result in job cuts
choices.C: Lack of support from senior management
choices.D: Lack of tools that support the quality infrastructure

content: Which of the following is a valid software quality goal?

choices.A: Improve quality by 100% within one year.
choices.B: Implement metrics without increasing project costs.
choices.C: Reduce the average number of defects found during code inspection by 50%.
choices.D: Achieve a cumulative defect removal efficiency greater than 90% within 18 months.

content: Which of the following is a characteristic of a successful defect prevention program?

choices.D: It is initiated at the end of the design phase.
choices.A: It is performed using a top-down approach.
choices.B: Defects are identified and removed prior to release.
choices.C: A root cause analysis of defects is conducted and defect data are tracked.

content: Which of the following is the most important feature of an audit report?

choices.D: It is based on the lead auditor's recommendations.
choices.C: It includes responses to all checklist questions.

content: Software quality assurance provides a means for:

choices.D: Achieving 100% inspection of all product units
choices.A: Assigning quality responsibilities to all key personnel

content: Which of the following is a non-value added activity?
Which of the following best describes the purpose of a problem reporting system?

choices.A: To collect and report information on the status of software defects or process nonconformances
choices.C: To collect information of software defects or process nonconformances
choices.D: To report and collect information on software defects

content: One of the roles of software quality assurance (SQA) is to ensure compliance with standards and procedures. The benefit of this effort is to:

choices.A: Increase the status of the SQA organization
choices.D: Reduce the responsibility of top management for quality

content: The goal of software quality assurance should be:
Most often, a supplier is selected based upon quality, delivery, technology, life cycle cost, and:

choices.C: Their track record with other customers

content: Modifying or redesigning a product would most likely occur during which two of the PDCA phases?
A prevention versus detection philosophy requires:

choices.B: Prevention effort early in the life cycle
choices.C: Prevention action upon appearance of defects

content: Planning the details of the audit and reporting obstacles while performing the audit are the responsibility of the:
What is potentially the greatest weakness in software problem reporting?

choices.B: Failure to not indicate the time and location of the defect
choices.C: Failure to follow-up with appropriate corrective action
choices.D: Failure to identify the programmer who created the defect
choices.A: Failure to adequately describe the defect

content: When outsourcing project work, as compared to process work, which of the following attributes normally applies?

choices.A: Repeats in a short time frame

content: What lean technique is most widely used to make problems visible?
Which of the following approaches maintains and improves working standards by small gradual evolutionary improvements
Identify the type of quality goal that cuts across many departments and addresses issues that are applicable organization wide
The performance of software inspections is considered what type of quality cost?
The DMAIC process followed by many six sigma teams is a:
Software stakeholder identification primarily consists of which of the following observations?

choices.A: Naming a person to be responsible for the QMS
choices.B: Recognizing those who have an interest in a projects outcome
choices.C: Identifying software requirements for the project managers
choices.D: Finding a coordinator for software planning decisions

content: What method uses mistake-proofing to eliminate defects in software?
Which of the following types of audits should be used to ensure that detail design is being done according to the software development plan?
Which of the following is a method for calculating a quality cost factor due to an external failure?

choices.A: Totaling the penalty fees that must be paid to the customer due to late delivery of a software product
choices.B: Measuring the amount of effort spent performing code reviews
choices.C: Measuring the amount of time spent fixing defects found during system testing
choices.D: Measuring the customer's system downtime over a one-year period

content: Which of the following would be the most useful criterion to use when determining which subcontractor to select for a project?

choices.A: The subcontractor's prior experience with similar applications
choices.B: The subcontractor's process capability maturity level
choices.C: The prime contractor's costs for evaluating and managing the subcontractor
choices.D: The prime contractor's process capability maturity level

content: The most successful quality program requires the support of which of the following groups?
Which of the following is an appropriate reason to use quality assurance test consultants to monitor an inspection process?

choices.B: They increase indirect overhead costs only.
choices.C: They bring specific knowledge that can be retained by the work group.
choices.D: They expedite the task without increasing the labor costs.
choices.A: They bear the liability risk instead of the company that hired them.
